intro: Paepalanthus venustoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments and stores water in its thick, fleshy stems. Its flowers are typically short-lived but attract pollinators such as bees and moths. Paepalanthus venustoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and resilience.
